results.title: Priit Parn: selected films
results.brief_description: This tape features three films from the award winning Estonian animation director and political cartoonist, Priit Parn. An artist who uses animation to satirise and parody the old Soviet system and the conflicting outcomes of Perestroika. His films are rich with repetition and allusion, and as with much Eastern European animation, is laden with symbolism. “Time out” follows the antics of a hero cat (produced by Hille Koosk); “Breakfast on the grass” provides a parallel with Manet’s work and reveals bureaucracy at its most malign (produced by Tallinnfilm); “Hotel E” explores the process of Glasnost, using a hotel setting as a metaphor for East and West (produced by Olav Osolin).

results.title: Priest
results.creator_credit: Electric Pictures (Aust), PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, BBC, Josephine Ward, George Faber and Antonia Bird
results.brief_description: A young priest tests his faith and vocation when assigned to a working class Parish in Liverpool. When a teenage girl confesses of her father’s incestuous advances, he is torn by the rituals of a Church which swears him to silence and to which he owes obedience, and his innate sense of justice. This conflict is compounded by his struggle with his own desires and sexuality as he enters into an illicit homosexual relationship. Linus Roache is excellent and well supported by a cast including Tom Wilkinson, Cathy Tyson and Robert Carlyle. “Priest” does not seek to attack organised religion; instead it offers a window into the heart and mind of a believer who struggles daily with his faith and vocation to find a true path.

results.title: Pride and prejudice. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: BBC, ABC-TV (Australia), Jonathan Powell and Cyril Coke
results.brief_description: Fay Weldon’s screenplay is outstanding in this production of the much loved Jane Austen novel. Elizabeth Bennett takes an immediate dislike to the haughty but wealthy and handsome Mr. Darcy. Her prejudice blinds her to his true character, while his pride and belief in his own superiority, alienates him from most of society. Their path to love and happiness leads them to not only discovering each other, but to a better understanding of their own natures, faults and strengths. Stars Elizabeth Garvie and David Rintoul as Elizabeth and Darcy.

results.title: Pride and prejudice. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: BBC, Arts Entertainment Network, Sue Birtwistle and Simon Langton
results.brief_description: Jane Austen’s famous novel is brought to life in this vibrant, fresh adaptation. Full of energy, the script, performances, sets, locations and costume design are excellent, while the overall production veers away from the formality of previous adaptations. Colin Firth and Jennifer Ehle are Darcy and Elizabeth and they are joined by a large and well-known cast including Barbara Leigh Hunt, Alison Steadman, Julia Sawalha and Susannah Harker. The underlying initial tension between Elizabeth and Darcy, develops into love, and their faults; pride on his part and prejudice on hers, blossoms into a deep and lasting mutual respect.
results.creator_credit_for_label: BBC, Arts Entertainment Network, Sue Birtwistle and Simon Langton

results.title: Pride and prejudice. Part 2
results.brief_description: This BBC production of Jane Austen’s classic novel has been highly acclaimed for the strength of characterisation and beauty of the locations. In this second part of the story Elizabeth Bennet, the wilful heroine, learns rather painfully that people and events are not always what they appear to be. It is in this harsh lesson that she overcomes her prejudice against the wealthy, handsome and proud Mr Darcy - the best of all possible catches in a society obsessed with marriage contracts.

results.title: Pride and prejudice. Part 1
results.brief_description: One of the greatest works of English literature is vividly brought to life in this fine production of Jane Austen’s most popular novel. Fay Weldon’s dramatisation and Cyril Coke’s direction capture the wit and lightness of touch of the original work. The eternally fascinating Elizabeth Bennet and the proud aristocrat, Mr Darcy, are the central characters in a drama which revolves around a stormy clash of personalities.

results.title: Pride and prejudice (S) (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Hunt Stromberg and Robert Z Leonard
results.brief_description: Five marriageable daughters! What’s a mother to do? What’s a father to do? What are we to do? Laugh, cry and become totally entranced by “Pride and Prejudice”, Jane Austen’s classic comedy of manners. Adapted for the screen by Aldous Huxley, this energetic film Stars Greer Garson and Laurence Olivier. Also starring are Edmund Gwenn, Mary Boland, Maureen O’Sullivan and Ann Rutherford. The beautiful costumes are by renown designer Adrian.

results.title: Pride and prejudice
results.creator_credit: Chrysalis Films, South Australian Film Corporation, Terry Jennings and Scott Hicks
results.brief_description: Part 5 of a series on Australian women artists, examining some of their thoughts, struggles, aspirations, influences and disappointments, and the effect of sexual discrimination and stereotyping. Some of the women strongly believe in using their art as a form of political protest, but they all agree that their aim is to bring Australia out of the cultural desert and bring recognition to women generally as artists in their own right. The painters and sculptors include: Inge King, Margaret Hinder, Margaret Priest, Mirka Mora, Rinske Car, Anne Newmarch, Denese Oates, Kate Briscoe, Joan Grounds, Bonita Ely, Micky Allan and holographer, Margaret Benyon. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Pride - the saddle horse. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Junior social studies film showing various rules of the horse in modern life and tracing the developments and training of a colt until he becomes a prize saddle horse at three years of age. Depicts stages of colt’s growth, early life with mother, first shoeing, training for stance, breaking to the saddle, learning the gaits, and performing at a horse show.
